Create a frequency/proportion summary table by a set of variables

Source: R/e_table_sum_freq_prop.R
e_table_sum_freq_prop.Rd

Create a frequency/proportion summary table by a set of variables

e_table_sum_freq_prop(dat, var_names, sw_sort_prop = TRUE)

Arguments

dat

data.frame or tibble

var_names

list of variable names

sw_sort_prop

TRUE/FALSE to sort the last variable descending by proportion within the other variables

Value

tab_summary a summary table

Examples

e_table_sum_freq_prop(
    dat           = ggplot2::mpg
  , var_names     = c("drv", "cyl", "class")
  , sw_sort_prop  = TRUE
  ) %>%
  print(n = Inf)
#> # A tibble: 26 x 5
#>    drv     cyl class          n  prop
#>    <chr> <int> <chr>      <int> <dbl>
#>  1 4         4 compact        8 0.348
#>  2 4         4 suv            8 0.348
#>  3 4         4 subcompact     4 0.174
#>  4 4         4 pickup         3 0.13 
#>  5 4         6 suv           16 0.5  
#>  6 4         6 pickup        10 0.312
#>  7 4         6 compact        4 0.125
#>  8 4         6 midsize        2 0.062
#>  9 4         8 suv           27 0.562
#> 10 4         8 pickup        20 0.417
#> 11 4         8 midsize        1 0.021
#> 12 f         4 compact       24 0.414
#> 13 f         4 subcompact    17 0.293
#> 14 f         4 midsize       16 0.276
#> 15 f         4 minivan        1 0.017
#> 16 f         5 compact        2 0.5  
#> 17 f         5 subcompact     2 0.5  
#> 18 f         6 midsize       21 0.488
#> 19 f         6 minivan       10 0.233
#> 20 f         6 compact        9 0.209
#> 21 f         6 subcompact     3 0.07 
#> 22 f         8 midsize        1 1    
#> 23 r         6 subcompact     4 1    
#> 24 r         8 suv           11 0.524
#> 25 r         8 2seater        5 0.238
#> 26 r         8 subcompact     5 0.238
